data: {"concept_id": "reader_manipulators", "concept_name": "Reader Manipulators (Part 3)", "set": "Narrative", "type": "element", "definition": "Techniques that control belief, emotion, and expectation in readers by managing information, framing, and rhythm.", "axes": "tool|fair_play|visibility|intensity", "axis_values": "dramatic_irony|situational_irony|red_herring|foreshadowing|withheld_info|twist|loyalty_shift|suspense_misdirection|emotional_juxtaposition|framing|structural_delay|unreliable_narration | fair|borderline|unfair | overt|subtle|invisible | low|medium|high", "source_file": "Reader Manipulators Part 3.md", "source_md5": "80d7b0123f730919041e6e2f6629ca2e", "last_modified_iso": "2025-09-30T20:32:25.366447Z"}
